esipy package

Submodules

esipy.atomicfiles module

esipy.atomicfiles.read_aimall(path='.')[source]

Reads the AOMs from AIMAll. :param path: Path of the directory of the files.

Returns:

The AOMs in ESIpy format stored in ‘ESI.Smo’.

esipy.atomicfiles.read_aoms(source, path='.')[source]

Reads the AOMs from another program and transforms them into ESIpy’s AOMs. :param source: Source program to read the files. :param path: Path of the directory of the files.

Returns:

The AOMs in ESIpy format stored in ‘ESI.Smo’.

esipy.atomicfiles.read_esipy(path='.')[source]

Reads the AOMs from ESIpy’s writeaoms() method. :param path: Path of the directory of the files.

Returns:

The AOMs in ESIpy format stored in ‘ESI.Smo’.

esipy.atomicfiles.write_aoms(mol, mf, name, Smo, ring=None, partition=None)[source]

Writes the AOMs as an input for the ESI-3D code.

Parameters:

  • instance (mf (SCF) – None): PySCF’s Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • optional – None): PySCF’s Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • default – None): PySCF’s Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • instance – None): PySCF’s object holds all parameters to control SCF.

  • optional – None): PySCF’s object holds all parameters to control SCF.

  • default – None): PySCF’s object holds all parameters to control SCF.

  • name (string) – A string containing the name of the calculation.

  • Smo (list of matrices or str) – Specifies the Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis. This can either be a list of matrices generated from the make_aoms() function or a string with the filename/path where the AOMs are saved.

  • rings (list or list of lists of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system. Can contain several rings as a list of lists.

  • (str (partition) – None): Specifies the atom-in-molecule partition scheme. Options include ‘mulliken’, ‘lowdin’, ‘meta_lowdin’, ‘nao’, and ‘iao’.

  • optional – None): Specifies the atom-in-molecule partition scheme. Options include ‘mulliken’, ‘lowdin’, ‘meta_lowdin’, ‘nao’, and ‘iao’.

  • default – None): Specifies the atom-in-molecule partition scheme. Options include ‘mulliken’, ‘lowdin’, ‘meta_lowdin’, ‘nao’, and ‘iao’.

Generates:

A directory named ‘name’_’partition’. A file for each atom, ‘.int’, containing its AOM, readable for the ESI-3D code. A generalized input to the ESI-3D code, as ‘name’.bad. If no ring is specified, none will be displayed. A file ‘name’.titles containing the names of the generated .int files.

esipy.indicators module

esipy.indicators.compute_av1245(arr, Smo, partition)[source]

Computes the AV1245 and AVmin indices. Not available for rings smaller than 6 members.

Parameters:

  • arr (list of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system.

  • Smo (list of matrices) – Specifies the Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis.

  • partition (str) – Specifies the atom-in-molecule partition scheme. Options include ‘mulliken’, ‘lowdin’, ‘meta_lowdin’, ‘nao’, and ‘iao’.

Returns:

tuple

The AV1245 index, the AVmin index and each of the AV1245 in a list for the output, respectively.

esipy.indicators.compute_av1245_no(arr, Smo, partition)[source]

Computes the AV1245 and AVmin indices. Not available for rings smaller than 6 members.

Parameters:

  • arr (list of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system.

  • Smo (list of matrices) – Specifies the Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis.

  • partition (str) – Specifies the atom-in-molecule partition scheme. Options include ‘mulliken’, ‘lowdin’, ‘meta_lowdin’, ‘nao’, and ‘iao’.

Returns:

tuple

The AV1245 index, the AVmin index and each of the AV1245 in a list for the output, respectively.

esipy.indicators.compute_bla(arr, mol, geom=None)[source]

Computes the BLA and BLA_c indices.

Parameters:

  • rings (list of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system.

  • instance (mol (SCF) – None): PySCF’s Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • optional – None): PySCF’s Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • default – None): PySCF’s Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • floats (geom (list of) – None): Molecular coordinates, typically obtained from mol.atom_coords().

  • optional – None): Molecular coordinates, typically obtained from mol.atom_coords().

  • default – None): Molecular coordinates, typically obtained from mol.atom_coords().

Returns:

tuple

Contains the BLA and the BLA_c indices, respectively.

esipy.indicators.compute_boa(arr, Smo)[source]

Computes the BOA and BOA_c indices.

Parameters:

  • arr (list of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system.

  • Smo (list of matrices) – Specifies the Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis.

Returns:

tuple

Contains the BOA and the BOA_c indices, respectively.

esipy.indicators.compute_boa_no(arr, Smo)[source]

Computes the BOA and BOA_c indices.

Parameters:

  • arr (list of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system.

  • Smo (list of matrices) – Specifies the Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis.

Returns:

tuple

Contains the BOA and the BOA_c indices, respectively.

esipy.indicators.compute_flu(arr, mol, Smo, flurefs=None, connectivity=None, partition=None)[source]

Computes the FLU index.

Parameters:

  • arr (list of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system.

  • instance (mol (SCF) – None): PySCF’s Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • optional – None): PySCF’s Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • default – None): PySCF’s Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • Smo (list of matrices or str) – Specifies the Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis. This can either be a list of matrices generated from the make_aoms() function or a string with the filename/path where the AOMs are saved.

  • (dict (flurefs) – None): User-provided references for Delocalization Indices used in the FLU index calculation.

  • optional – None): User-provided references for Delocalization Indices used in the FLU index calculation.

  • default – None): User-provided references for Delocalization Indices used in the FLU index calculation.

  • int (connectivity (list of) – None): List of atomic symbols in the order they appear in mol, representing ring connectivity.

  • optional – None): List of atomic symbols in the order they appear in mol, representing ring connectivity.

  • default – None): List of atomic symbols in the order they appear in mol, representing ring connectivity.

  • partition (str) – Specifies the atom-in-molecule partition scheme. Options include ‘mulliken’, ‘lowdin’, ‘meta_lowdin’, ‘nao’, and ‘iao’.

Returns:

float

Value of the FLU index.

esipy.indicators.compute_homa(arr, mol, geom=None, homarefs=None, connectivity=None)[source]

Computes the HOMA index.

Parameters:

  • arr (list of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system.

  • mol (SCF instance) – PySCF’s Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • floats (geom (list of) – None): Molecular coordinates, typically obtained from mol.atom_coords().

  • optional – None): Molecular coordinates, typically obtained from mol.atom_coords().

  • default – None): Molecular coordinates, typically obtained from mol.atom_coords().

  • (dict (homarefs) – None): User-provided references for the HOMA index. Required data as in [Krygowski, et al. Chem. Rev. 114 6383-6422 (2014)].

  • optional – None): User-provided references for the HOMA index. Required data as in [Krygowski, et al. Chem. Rev. 114 6383-6422 (2014)].

  • default – None): User-provided references for the HOMA index. Required data as in [Krygowski, et al. Chem. Rev. 114 6383-6422 (2014)].

  • int (connectivity (list of) – None): List of atomic symbols in the order they appear in mol, representing ring connectivity.

  • optional – None): List of atomic symbols in the order they appear in mol, representing ring connectivity.

  • default – None): List of atomic symbols in the order they appear in mol, representing ring connectivity.

Returns:

tuple

Contains the HOMA value as well as the EN and GEO components.

esipy.indicators.compute_homer(arr, mol, geom=None, homerrefs=None, connectivity=None)[source]

Computes the HOMER index.

Parameters:

  • arr (list of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system.

  • mol (SCF instance) – PySCF’s Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • floats (geom (list of) – None): Molecular coordinates, typically obtained from mol.atom_coords().

  • optional – None): Molecular coordinates, typically obtained from mol.atom_coords().

  • default – None): Molecular coordinates, typically obtained from mol.atom_coords().

  • (dict (homerrefs) – None): User-provided references for optimal distance and polarizability in HOMA or HOMER indices.

  • optional – None): User-provided references for optimal distance and polarizability in HOMA or HOMER indices.

  • default – None): User-provided references for optimal distance and polarizability in HOMA or HOMER indices.

  • int (connectivity (list of) – None): List of atomic symbols in the order they appear in mol, representing ring connectivity.

  • optional – None): List of atomic symbols in the order they appear in mol, representing ring connectivity.

  • default – None): List of atomic symbols in the order they appear in mol, representing ring connectivity.

Returns:

float

The HOMER value.

esipy.indicators.compute_iring(arr, Smo)[source]

Calculation of the Iring aromaticity index.

Parameters:

  • arr (list of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system.

  • Smo (list of matrices) – Specifies the Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis.

Returns:

float

The Iring for the given ring connectivity.

esipy.indicators.compute_iring_no(arr, Smo)[source]

Calculation of the Iring aromaticity index for Natural Orbitals calculations.

Parameters:

  • arr (list of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system.

  • Smo (list of matrices) – Specifies the Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis.

Returns:

float

The Iring for the given ring connectivity.

esipy.indicators.compute_pdi(arr, Smo)[source]

Computes the PDI for the given 6-membered ring connectivity. Only computed for rings n=6.

Parameters:

  • arr (list of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system.

  • Smo (list of matrices) – Specifies the Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis.

Returns:

tuple

The list contains the PDI value and each of the DIs in para position.

esipy.indicators.compute_pdi_no(arr, Smo)[source]

Computes the PDI for the given 6-membered ring connectivity. Only computed for rings n=6.

Parameters:

  • arr (list of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system.

  • Smo (list of matrices) – Specifies the Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis.

Returns:

tuple

The list contains the PDI value and each of the DIs in para position.

esipy.indicators.find_flurefs(partition=None)[source]

Sets the reference of the FLU index based on the provided partition. The available options are “CC” from benzene, “CN” from pyridine, “BN” from borazine, “NN” from pyridazine and “CS” from thiophene, all obtained from optimized and single-point calculations at HF/6-31G(d) level of theory.

Parameters:

partition (str) – Specifies the atom-in-molecule partition scheme. Options include ‘mulliken’, ‘lowdin’, ‘meta_lowdin’, ‘nao’, and ‘iao’.

Returns:

dict

Contains the reference DI for each bond.

esipy.indicators.multiprocessing_mci(arr, Smo, ncores, partition)[source]

Computes the MCI split in different threads by generating all the permutations for a later distribution along the specified number of cores.

Parameters:

  • arr (list of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system.

  • Smo (list of matrices) – Specifies the Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis.

  • ncores (int) – Specifies the number of cores for multi-processing MCI calculation.

  • partition (str) – Specifies the atom-in-molecule partition scheme. Options include ‘mulliken’, ‘lowdin’, ‘meta_lowdin’, ‘nao’, and ‘iao’.

Returns:

float

MCI value for the given ring.

esipy.indicators.multiprocessing_mci_no(arr, Smo, ncores, partition)[source]

Computes the MCI from a Natural Orbitals calculation by generating all the permutations for a later distribution along the specified number of cores.

Parameters:

  • arr (list of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system.

  • Smo (list of matrices) – Specifies the Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis.

  • ncores (int) – Specifies the number of cores for multi-processing MCI calculation.

  • partition (str) – Specifies the atom-in-molecule partition scheme. Options include ‘mulliken’, ‘lowdin’, ‘meta_lowdin’, ‘nao’, and ‘iao’.

Returns:

float

MCI value for the given ring.

esipy.indicators.sequential_mci(arr, Smo, partition)[source]

Computes the MCI sequentially by computing the Iring without storing the permutations. Default option if no number of cores is specified.

Parameters:

  • arr (list of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system.

  • Smo (list of matrices) – Specifies the Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis.

  • partition (str) – Specifies the atom-in-molecule partition scheme. Options include ‘mulliken’, ‘lowdin’, ‘meta_lowdin’, ‘nao’, and ‘iao’.

Returns:

float

MCI value for the given ring.

esipy.indicators.sequential_mci_no(arr, Smo, partition)[source]

Computes the MCI sequentially for a Natural Orbitals calculation by computing the Iring without storing the permutations. Default option if no number of cores is specified.

Parameters:

  • arr (list of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system.

  • Smo (list of matrices) – Specifies the Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis.

  • partition (str) – Specifies the atom-in-molecule partition scheme. Options include ‘mulliken’, ‘lowdin’, ‘meta_lowdin’, ‘nao’, and ‘iao’.

Returns:

float

MCI value for the given ring.

esipy.make_aoms module

esipy.make_aoms.make_aoms(mol, mf, partition, save=None)[source]

Build the Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the Molecular Orbitals basis.

Parameters:

  • mol (SCF instance) – PySCF’s Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • mf (SCF instance) – PySCF’s object holds all parameters to control SCF.

  • partition – Specifies the atom-in-molecule partition scheme. Options include ‘mulliken’, ‘lowdin’, ‘meta_lowdin’, ‘nao’, and ‘iao’.

Returns:

list
Contains the atomic overlap matrices.

  • For restricted-SD calculations: a list of matrices with the AOMS.

  • For unrestricted-SD calculations: a list containing both alpha and beta lists of matrices as [Smo_alpha, Smo_beta].

Return type:

Smo

esipy.no module

esipy.no.arom_no(Smo, rings, partition, mol, mci=False, av1245=False, flurefs=None, homarefs=None, homerrefs=None, connectivity=None, geom=None, ncores=1, molinfo=None)[source]

Population analysis, localization and delocalization indices and aromaticity indicators for restricted AOMs.

Parameters:

  • Smo – list of matrices / string Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis generated from the make_aoms() function. Can also be a string with the name of the file or the path where the AOMS have been saved.

  • rings – list Contains a list of the indices of the atoms in the ring connectivity for the aromaticity calculations.

  • partition – string. Default: None Type of desired atom-in-molecule partition scheme. Options are ‘mulliken’, lowdin’, ‘meta_lowdin’, ‘nao’ and ‘iao’.

  • mol – an instance of SCF class. Default: None Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • mci – boolean. Default: None Whether to compute the MCI index.

  • av1245 – boolean. Default: None Whether to compute the AV1245 (and AVmin) indices.

  • flurefs – dictionary. Default: None User-provided references for the Delocalization Indices for the FLU index.

  • homarefs – dictionary. Default: None User-provided references for the distance and polarizability for the HOMA or HOMER indices.

  • homerrefs – dictionary. Default: None User-provided references for the optimal distance and polarizability for the HOMA or HOMER indices.

  • connectivity – list. Default: None The atomic symbols of the atoms in the ring in ‘mol’ order.

  • geom – list. Default: None The molecular coordinates as given by the mol.atom_coords() function.

  • ncores – integer Number of threads required for the calculation.

esipy.no.arom_no_from_aoms(Smo, rings, partition, mol, mci=True, av1245=True, flurefs=None, homarefs=None, homerrefs=None, connectivity=None, geom=None, ncores=1)[source]

Population analysis, localization and delocalization indices and aromaticity indicators for previously saved restricted AOMs.

Parameters:

  • Smo (list of matrices or str) – Specifies the Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis.

  • rings (list or list of lists of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system. Can contain several rings as a list of lists.

  • partition (str) – Specifies the atom-in-molecule partition scheme. Options include ‘mulliken’, ‘lowdin’, ‘meta_lowdin’, ‘nao’, and ‘iao’.

  • mol (SCF instance) – PySCF’s Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • (bool (av1245) – False): If True, the function computes the MCI index.

  • optional – False): If True, the function computes the MCI index.

  • default – False): If True, the function computes the MCI index.

  • (bool – False): If True, the function computes the AV1245 (and AVmin) indices.

  • optional – False): If True, the function computes the AV1245 (and AVmin) indices.

  • default – False): If True, the function computes the AV1245 (and AVmin) indices.

  • (dict (homerrefs) – None): User-provided references for Delocalization Indices used in the FLU index calculation.

  • optional – None): User-provided references for Delocalization Indices used in the FLU index calculation.

  • default – None): User-provided references for Delocalization Indices used in the FLU index calculation.

  • (dict – None): User-provided references for the HOMA index. Required data as in [Krygowski, et al. Chem. Rev. 114 6383-6422 (2014)].

  • optional – None): User-provided references for the HOMA index. Required data as in [Krygowski, et al. Chem. Rev. 114 6383-6422 (2014)].

  • default – None): User-provided references for the HOMA index. Required data as in [Krygowski, et al. Chem. Rev. 114 6383-6422 (2014)].

  • (dict – None): User-provided references for optimal distance and polarizability in HOMA or HOMER indices.

  • optional – None): User-provided references for optimal distance and polarizability in HOMA or HOMER indices.

  • default – None): User-provided references for optimal distance and polarizability in HOMA or HOMER indices.

  • int (connectivity (list of) – None): List of atomic symbols in the order they appear in mol, representing ring connectivity.

  • optional – None): List of atomic symbols in the order they appear in mol, representing ring connectivity.

  • default – None): List of atomic symbols in the order they appear in mol, representing ring connectivity.

  • floats (geom (list of) – None): Molecular coordinates, typically obtained from mol.atom_coords().

  • optional – None): Molecular coordinates, typically obtained from mol.atom_coords().

  • default – None): Molecular coordinates, typically obtained from mol.atom_coords().

  • str (molinfo (dict or) – None): Contains molecule and calculation details from the ‘molinfo()’ method inside ESI.

  • optional – None): Contains molecule and calculation details from the ‘molinfo()’ method inside ESI.

  • default – None): Contains molecule and calculation details from the ‘molinfo()’ method inside ESI.

  • (int (ncores) – 1): Specifies the number of cores for multi-processing MCI calculation.

  • optional – 1): Specifies the number of cores for multi-processing MCI calculation.

  • default – 1): Specifies the number of cores for multi-processing MCI calculation.

esipy.no.deloc_no(Smo, mol, molinfo=None)[source]

Population analysis, localization and delocalization indices for restricted AOMs.

Parameters:

  • mol – an instance of SCF class Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • Smo – list of matrices or string Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis generated from the make_aoms() function. Can also be a string with the name of the file or the path where the AOMS have been saved.

esipy.rest module

esipy.rest.arom_rest(Smo, rings, partition, mol, mci=False, av1245=False, flurefs=None, homarefs=None, homerrefs=None, connectivity=None, geom=None, ncores=1, molinfo=None)[source]

Population analysis, localization and delocalization indices and aromaticity indicators for restricted AOMs.

Parameters:

  • Smo (list of matrices or str) – Specifies the Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis.

  • rings (list or list of lists of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system. Can contain several rings as a list of lists.

  • partition (str) – Specifies the atom-in-molecule partition scheme. Options include ‘mulliken’, ‘lowdin’, ‘meta_lowdin’, ‘nao’, and ‘iao’.

  • mol (SCF instance) – PySCF’s Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • (bool (av1245) – False): If True, the function computes the MCI index.

  • optional – False): If True, the function computes the MCI index.

  • default – False): If True, the function computes the MCI index.

  • (bool – False): If True, the function computes the AV1245 (and AVmin) indices.

  • optional – False): If True, the function computes the AV1245 (and AVmin) indices.

  • default – False): If True, the function computes the AV1245 (and AVmin) indices.

  • (dict (homerrefs) – None): User-provided references for Delocalization Indices used in the FLU index calculation.

  • optional – None): User-provided references for Delocalization Indices used in the FLU index calculation.

  • default – None): User-provided references for Delocalization Indices used in the FLU index calculation.

  • (dict – None): User-provided references for the HOMA index. Required data as in [Krygowski, et al. Chem. Rev. 114 6383-6422 (2014)].

  • optional – None): User-provided references for the HOMA index. Required data as in [Krygowski, et al. Chem. Rev. 114 6383-6422 (2014)].

  • default – None): User-provided references for the HOMA index. Required data as in [Krygowski, et al. Chem. Rev. 114 6383-6422 (2014)].

  • (dict – None): User-provided references for optimal distance and polarizability in HOMA or HOMER indices.

  • optional – None): User-provided references for optimal distance and polarizability in HOMA or HOMER indices.

  • default – None): User-provided references for optimal distance and polarizability in HOMA or HOMER indices.

  • int (connectivity (list of) – None): List of atomic symbols in the order they appear in mol, representing ring connectivity.

  • optional – None): List of atomic symbols in the order they appear in mol, representing ring connectivity.

  • default – None): List of atomic symbols in the order they appear in mol, representing ring connectivity.

  • floats (geom (list of) – None): Molecular coordinates, typically obtained from mol.atom_coords().

  • optional – None): Molecular coordinates, typically obtained from mol.atom_coords().

  • default – None): Molecular coordinates, typically obtained from mol.atom_coords().

  • str (molinfo (dict or) – None): Contains molecule and calculation details from the ‘molinfo()’ method inside ESI.

  • optional – None): Contains molecule and calculation details from the ‘molinfo()’ method inside ESI.

  • default – None): Contains molecule and calculation details from the ‘molinfo()’ method inside ESI.

  • (int (ncores) – 1): Specifies the number of cores for multi-processing MCI calculation.

  • optional – 1): Specifies the number of cores for multi-processing MCI calculation.

  • default – 1): Specifies the number of cores for multi-processing MCI calculation.

esipy.rest.arom_rest_from_aoms(Smo, rings, partition, mol, mci=True, av1245=True, flurefs=None, homarefs=None, homerrefs=None, connectivity=None, geom=None, ncores=1)[source]

Population analysis, localization and delocalization indices and aromaticity indicators for previously saved restricted AOMs.

Parameters:

  • Smo (list of matrices or str) – Specifies the Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis.

  • rings (list or list of lists of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system. Can contain several rings as a list of lists.

  • partition (str) – Specifies the atom-in-molecule partition scheme. Options include ‘mulliken’, ‘lowdin’, ‘meta_lowdin’, ‘nao’, and ‘iao’.

  • mol (SCF instance) – PySCF’s Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • (bool (av1245) – False): If True, the function computes the MCI index.

  • optional – False): If True, the function computes the MCI index.

  • default – False): If True, the function computes the MCI index.

  • (bool – False): If True, the function computes the AV1245 (and AVmin) indices.

  • optional – False): If True, the function computes the AV1245 (and AVmin) indices.

  • default – False): If True, the function computes the AV1245 (and AVmin) indices.

  • (dict (homerrefs) – None): User-provided references for Delocalization Indices used in the FLU index calculation.

  • optional – None): User-provided references for Delocalization Indices used in the FLU index calculation.

  • default – None): User-provided references for Delocalization Indices used in the FLU index calculation.

  • (dict – None): User-provided references for the HOMA index. Required data as in [Krygowski, et al. Chem. Rev. 114 6383-6422 (2014)].

  • optional – None): User-provided references for the HOMA index. Required data as in [Krygowski, et al. Chem. Rev. 114 6383-6422 (2014)].

  • default – None): User-provided references for the HOMA index. Required data as in [Krygowski, et al. Chem. Rev. 114 6383-6422 (2014)].

  • (dict – None): User-provided references for optimal distance and polarizability in HOMA or HOMER indices.

  • optional – None): User-provided references for optimal distance and polarizability in HOMA or HOMER indices.

  • default – None): User-provided references for optimal distance and polarizability in HOMA or HOMER indices.

  • int (connectivity (list of) – None): List of atomic symbols in the order they appear in mol, representing ring connectivity.

  • optional – None): List of atomic symbols in the order they appear in mol, representing ring connectivity.

  • default – None): List of atomic symbols in the order they appear in mol, representing ring connectivity.

  • floats (geom (list of) – None): Molecular coordinates, typically obtained from mol.atom_coords().

  • optional – None): Molecular coordinates, typically obtained from mol.atom_coords().

  • default – None): Molecular coordinates, typically obtained from mol.atom_coords().

  • str (molinfo (dict or) – None): Contains molecule and calculation details from the ‘molinfo()’ method inside ESI.

  • optional – None): Contains molecule and calculation details from the ‘molinfo()’ method inside ESI.

  • default – None): Contains molecule and calculation details from the ‘molinfo()’ method inside ESI.

  • (int (ncores) – 1): Specifies the number of cores for multi-processing MCI calculation.

  • optional – 1): Specifies the number of cores for multi-processing MCI calculation.

  • default – 1): Specifies the number of cores for multi-processing MCI calculation.

esipy.tools.mol_info(mol=None, mf=None, save=None, partition=None)[source]

Obtains information from the molecule and the calculation to complement the main code function without requiring the ‘mol’ and ‘mf’ objects.

Parameters:

  • instance (mf (SCF) – None): PySCF’s Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • optional – None): PySCF’s Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • default – None): PySCF’s Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • instance – None): PySCF’s object holds all parameters to control SCF.

  • optional – None): PySCF’s object holds all parameters to control SCF.

  • default – None): PySCF’s object holds all parameters to control SCF.

  • save – string Sets the name of the file if they want to be stored in disk. Automatic ‘.molinfo’ extension will be added.

  • partition – string Type of desired atom-in-molecule partition scheme. Options are ‘mulliken’, lowdin’, ‘meta_lowdin’, ‘nao’ and ‘iao’.

Returns:

Atomic symbols, atomic charges, basis set, molecular coordinates, type of calculation, total energy, module, and xc functional if present.

Return type:

Dictionary containing

esipy.tools.wf_type(Smo)[source]

Checks the topology of the AOMs to obtain the method and type of calculation. :param Smo: The Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis.

Returns:

“rest” for restricted calculations and “unrest” for unrestricted calculations.

esipy.unrest module

esipy.unrest.arom_unrest(Smo, rings, partition, mol, mci=False, av1245=False, flurefs=None, homarefs=None, homerrefs=None, connectivity=None, geom=None, ncores=1, molinfo=None)[source]

Population analysis, localization and delocalization indices and aromaticity indicators for unrestricted AOMs.

Parameters:

  • Smo (list of matrices or str) – Specifies the Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis.

  • rings (list or list of lists of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system. Can contain several rings as a list of lists.

  • partition (str) – Specifies the atom-in-molecule partition scheme. Options include ‘mulliken’, ‘lowdin’, ‘meta_lowdin’, ‘nao’, and ‘iao’.

  • mol (SCF instance) – PySCF’s Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • (bool (av1245) – False): If True, the function computes the MCI index.

  • optional – False): If True, the function computes the MCI index.

  • default – False): If True, the function computes the MCI index.

  • (bool – False): If True, the function computes the AV1245 (and AVmin) indices.

  • optional – False): If True, the function computes the AV1245 (and AVmin) indices.

  • default – False): If True, the function computes the AV1245 (and AVmin) indices.

  • (dict (homerrefs) – None): User-provided references for Delocalization Indices used in the FLU index calculation.

  • optional – None): User-provided references for Delocalization Indices used in the FLU index calculation.

  • default – None): User-provided references for Delocalization Indices used in the FLU index calculation.

  • (dict – None): User-provided references for the HOMA index. Required data as in [Krygowski, et al. Chem. Rev. 114 6383-6422 (2014)].

  • optional – None): User-provided references for the HOMA index. Required data as in [Krygowski, et al. Chem. Rev. 114 6383-6422 (2014)].

  • default – None): User-provided references for the HOMA index. Required data as in [Krygowski, et al. Chem. Rev. 114 6383-6422 (2014)].

  • (dict – None): User-provided references for optimal distance and polarizability in HOMA or HOMER indices.

  • optional – None): User-provided references for optimal distance and polarizability in HOMA or HOMER indices.

  • default – None): User-provided references for optimal distance and polarizability in HOMA or HOMER indices.

  • int (connectivity (list of) – None): List of atomic symbols in the order they appear in mol, representing ring connectivity.

  • optional – None): List of atomic symbols in the order they appear in mol, representing ring connectivity.

  • default – None): List of atomic symbols in the order they appear in mol, representing ring connectivity.

  • floats (geom (list of) – None): Molecular coordinates, typically obtained from mol.atom_coords().

  • optional – None): Molecular coordinates, typically obtained from mol.atom_coords().

  • default – None): Molecular coordinates, typically obtained from mol.atom_coords().

Population analysis, localization and delocalization indices and aromaticity indicators for previously saved restricted AOMs.

  • Smo (list of matrices or str) – Specifies the Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the MO basis.

  • rings (list or list of lists of int) – Contains the indices defining the ring connectivity of a system. Can contain several rings as a list of lists.

  • partition (str) – Specifies the atom-in-molecule partition scheme. Options include ‘mulliken’, ‘lowdin’, ‘meta_lowdin’, ‘nao’, and ‘iao’.

  • mol (SCF instance) – PySCF’s Mole class and helper functions to handle parameters and attributes for GTO integrals.

  • optional – False): If True, the function computes the MCI index.

  • default – False): If True, the function computes the MCI index.

  • default – None): User-provided references for Delocalization Indices used in the FLU index calculation.

  • default – None): User-provided references for the HOMA index. Required data as in [Krygowski, et al. Chem. Rev. 114 6383-6422 (2014)].

Module contents

class esipy.ESI(Smo=None, rings=None, mol=None, mf=None, partition=None, mci=None, av1245=None, flurefs=None, homarefs=None, homerrefs=None, connectivity=None, geom=None, molinfo=None, ncores=1, saveaoms=None, savemolinfo=None, name='calc', readsource=None, readpath='.')[source]

Bases: object

property Smo
aoms()[source]

Generates the Atomic Overlap Matrices (AOMs) in the Molecular Orbitals basis. Can be saved in binary through the ‘ESI.saveaoms’ attribute set to a string. Will automatically overwrite ‘ESI.Smo’ attribute.

Returns:

The AOMs in MO basis

property av1245
calc()[source]

Main ESIpy. Calculation of population analysis, localization and delocalization indices and electronic (and geometric) aromaticity indicators.

property mci
property molinfo
property partition
readaoms()[source]

Reads the AOMs from a directory in AIMAll and ESIpy format. Overwrites ‘ESI.Smo’ variable.

Returns:

The AOMs in the MO basis.

writeaoms()[source]

Writes ESIpy’s AOMs in AIMAll format.

Generates:

  • A ‘_atomicfiles/’ directory with all the files created.

  • A ‘.int’ file for each atom with its corresponding AOM.

  • A ‘name.files’ with a list of the names of the ‘.int’ files.

  • A ‘name.bad’ with a standard input for the ESI-3D code.
